description: City: Covington, LALola deux the newest addition to Lola Restaurant!! You can find our food truck rolling in downtown Covington Friday & Saturday nights.Three short blocks to right of Boston Street lies a restaurant where hundreds of people dine and socialize each week. As a result of Hurricane Katrina in 2005, Keith and Nealy Frentz opened the doors of LOLA restaurant in downtown Covington. Having both graduated from Johnson & Wales University and holding titled positions at Brennans on Royal Street, their training and experience has made LOLA what it is today."Counter service allows us to keep business rolling at a steady pace, but our influx of customers and fast pace does not take away from the quality of food we prepare. In our original 1940's train caboose, everything from home-made bread, soups, specials, desserts and lemonade are made fresh daily. Frequent trips to the farmers markets and a good relationship with local seafood purveyors allow our food to be simple, fresh and seasonal. Our goal is to provide customers with affordable home style food in a casual upbeat atmosphere. It just happens to be in an old train depot.""Friday and Saturday nights allow us to bring our fine dining experience to downtown Covington. Candlelight dining, a full bar and a contemporary menu are what make LOLA diners appreciate the passion we instill into each dish.""When's the last time your food came out of a caboose?"
name: Lola Deux
